intro: Fimbristylis spathacea, commonly known as the narrowleaf spathephyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and compact inflorescences. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets, which are clustered along the stem. It is often found in wetland habitats, including marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Fimbristylis spathacea is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in these ecosystems.
